picker noun [C]
(COLLECT)
a person or a machine that picks crops: He's looking for work as a fruit picker. Sharecroppers were displaced by tractors and mechanized cotton pickers.
a person who works in a supermarket or warehouse getting the things from the shelves that people have ordered over the internet : Pickers take goods off the shelves, and delivery drivers take the goods to the customer. The company's marketing manager joined the company as a warehouse picker.
